1.name: Das Cabinet des Dr. Caligari
1.description: Hypnotist Dr. Caligari uses a somnambulist, Cesare, to commit murders.

2.name: Der Golem, wie er in die Welt kam
2.description: In 16th-century Prague, a rabbi creates the Golem - a giant creature made of clay. Using sorcery, he brings the creature to life in order to protect the Jews of Prague from persecution.

3.name: Way Down East
3.description: A naive country girl is tricked into a sham marriage by a wealthy womanizer, then must rebuild her life despite the taint of having borne a child out of wedlock.

4.name: Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
4.description: Dr. Henry Jekyll experiments with scientific means of revealing the hidden, dark side of man and releases a murderer from within himself.

5.name: Sex
5.description: A broadway actress uses her sex appeal to ruin a marriage only to dump her lover for a richer prospect.

7.name: The Mark of Zorro
7.description: A seemingly idiotic fop is really the courageous vigilante Zorro, who seeks to protect the oppressed.

8.name: Within Our Gates
8.description: Abandoned by her fiancé, an educated black woman with a shocking past dedicates herself to helping a near bankrupt school for impoverished black youths.

9.name: The Last of the Mohicans
9.description: As Alice and Cora Munro attempt to find their father, a British officer in the French and Indian War, they are set upon by French soldiers and their cohorts, Huron tribesmen led by the evil...                See full summary »

10.name: Erotikon
10.description: EROTIKON surely pushed the boundaries of what was acceptable on the screen in 1920: Irene, the bored wife of a distracted entomologist, pursues a womanizing aviator, but she may actually be...                See full summary »

11.name: The Flapper
11.description: Ginger grows up in a slow town. Because of her wild attitude, her father decides to send her to a strict boarding school. Despite the strictness, the girls have fun getting into flapper lifestyle trouble including flirting.

12.name: Pollyanna
12.description: An orphan's optimistic outlook brings a change to the ill-tempered town in which she resides to her aunt.

13.name: Outside the Law
13.description: In this early collaboration with director Tod Browning (Dracula, Freaks), Chaney delivers a dual performance of dramatic intensity, starring as Ah Wing, a kind-hearted student of Confucian ...                See full summary »

14.name: Shakuntala
14.description: Raja Dushyanta is out hunting in a nearby forest happens upon an attractive maiden, named Shakuntala, and instantly falls in love with her. He gives Shakuntala his ring as a symbol of his ...                See full summary »

15.name: The Penalty
15.description: A deformed criminal mastermind plans to loot the city of San Francisco as well as revenge himself on the doctor who mistakenly amputated his legs.

16.name: The Son of Tarzan
16.description: The scenario follows the book closely. Tarzan's son Jack (Korak to the apes) is kidnapped from England by Tarzan's old enemy Paulovich. He escapes into the African jungle with the help of ...                See full summary »

17.name: Sumurun
17.description: The favorite slave girl of a tyrannical sheik falls in love with a cloth merchant. Meanwhile, a hunchback clown suffers unrequited love for a traveling dancer who wants to join the harem.

18.name: Genuine
18.description: Extremely rare work of Robert Wiene. From the director and year of excellent "The Cabinet of Dr. Caligari" this work was eventually overshadowed by the success of Caligari. It has a dreamy atmosphere, like another world or something.

19.name: The Revenge of Tarzan
19.description: Tarzan and Jane are sailing for France in answer to a call for help from Countess de Coude who is being persecuted by her brother Rokoff. After a duel with the Countess' jealous husband, ...                See full summary »

20.name: The Virgin of Stamboul
20.description: Achmet Bey, a Turkish chieftain, catches one of his many wives in adultery and murders her lover. Throwing aside the cuckolding wife, he abducts his harem an innocent girl. However, a brave...                See full summary »

21.name: Why Change Your Wife?
21.description: Robert and Beth Gordon are married but share little. He runs into Sally at a cabaret and the Gordons are soon divorced. Just as he gets bored with Sally's superficiality, Beth strives to ...                See full summary »

22.name: Anna Boleyn
22.description: The story of the ill-fated second wife of the English king Henry VIII, whose marriage to the Henry led to momentous political and religious turmoil in England.

23.name: Prästänkan
23.description: A young man is elected by a small village to be its parson. As part of his duties, he is required to marry the widow of the parson before him. This poses two problems--first, the widow is ...                See full summary »

24.name: Der Januskopf
24.description: See everything in the book "Conrad Veidt on Screen" by John T. Soister (McFarland 2002), pages 109-113.

25.name: Blade af Satans bog
25.description: In 4 episodic tales of human suffering; the temptation of Jesus, the Spanish Inquisition, the French Revolution and the Russo-Finnish war of 1918, Satan attempts to win God's favor.

26.name: Suds
26.description: A London laundress attempts to rise above her station in order to capture the love of a wealthy young man, thus missing out on the truer love of one of her own class.

27.name: Something New
27.description: A young woman visiting in Mexico is kidnapped by a gang of bandits, who drag her through the rugged wilderness to their hideout. She manages to leave word for her friend Bill, who knows the...                See full summary »

28.name: Terror Island
28.description: An inventor travels to the South Seas, where there is buried treasure belonging to a girl. The girl's father is being held captive by cannibals until she returns a pearl that belongs to one of their idols.

29.name: Huckleberry Finn
29.description: Huckleberry Finn, a rambuctious boy adventurer chafing under the bonds of civilization, escapes his humdrum world and his selfish, plotting father by sailing a raft down the Mississippi ...                See full summary »

30.name: The Symbol of the Unconquered
30.description: Racists learn that the land a negro owns lies over a vast oil field, and threaten his life when he refuses to sell.

31.name: Billions
31.description: Billions is a lost 1920 American silent comedy film produced by and starring Alla Nazimova and distributed by Metro Pictures. Ray Smallwood directed. It is based on a French play, L'Homme riche, by Jean Jose Frappa and Henry Dupuy-Mazuel.

32.name: Satanas
32.description: A three-part historical film, with episode one taking place in ancient Egypt, the second is based on the Hugo novel, and the third episode takes place during the 1917 Russian revolution.

33.name: The Saphead
33.description: The simple-minded son of a rich financier must find his own way in the world.

34.name: The Daughter of Dawn
34.description: This restored silent film features a love triangle involving a Kiowa chief's daughter and ensuing conflict between Kiowa and Comanche villages.

37.name: Das wandernde Bild
37.description: Mia May has surrendered herself to a disciple of free love, and, having given birth to a child, marries the twin brother and Doppelgänger of her chosen lover.

38.name: Von morgens bis mitternachts
38.description: A Cashier in a bank in a small German town is alerted to the power of money by the visit of a rich Italian lady. He embezzles 60, 000 Marks and leaves for the capital city, where he ...                See full summary »

39.name: Die Spinnen, 2. Teil - Das Brillantenschiff
39.description: Kay Hoog wants to stop the organisation "Die Spinnen" to get a certain diamond, that will give the owning woman the crown of Asia, but the man, who should be the owner of that diamond, ...                See full summary »

41.name: The Mollycoddle
41.description: An American who has lived much of his life outside the country returns to Arizona for the first time in years and encounters villainy.

43.name: Dinty
43.description: Dinty is a newsboy whose fight to care for his ailing mother leads him into conflicts with the other boys on the street and then with drug smugglers in Chinatown.

44.name: Der Bucklige und die Tänzerin
44.description: Wilton, a hunchback, who was always scorned and ridiculed by women, returns from Java a rich man after having discovered a diamond mine. He romances Gina, who is on the rebound from a ...                See full summary »

46.name: The Man from Snowy River
46.description: A country boy, Jim Conroy, is living a dissolute life in the city, running around with vamp Helen Ross. When his father cuts him off, he is dumped by Helen and returns to the bush.

47.name: Mästerman
47.description: A pawnbroker, widely despised, called Mästerman is the subject of tales of terror and cruelty. In his profession, he is merciless.

48.name: Opium
48.description: A Chinese opium dealer takes revenge on Westerners who have corrupted his wife.

49.name: Kohlhiesels Töchter
49.description: Somewhere in Southern Bavaria Xaver wants to marry Gretel, but her father Kohlhiesel wants his elder daughter Liesel to marry first. The problem is, nobody wants to marry her, because she's...                See full summary »

50.name: The Round-Up
50.description: An overweight sheriff does his best to assist a man accused of theft.
